template.description: A demo flow that creates a local Http server that accepts POST requests. The flow also has a "client" which is configured to POST a 1kb flow to the server.
template.name: Self Referencing Http Client and Server

value.description: The maximum number of HTTP requests that can be outstanding at any one time. Any attempt to register an additional HTTP Request will cause an error
value.name: Maximum Outstanding Requests

value.description: Specifies how long an HTTP Request should be left unanswered before being evicted from the cache and being responded to with a Service Unavailable status code
value.name: Request Expiration

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming HTTP requests
value.name: Listening Port

value.description: The Hostname to bind to. If not specified, will bind to all hosts
value.name: Hostname

value.description: The SSL Context Service to use in order to secure the server. If specified, the server will accept only HTTPS requests; otherwise, the server will accept only HTTP requests
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: A Regular Expression that specifies the valid HTTP Paths that are allowed in the incoming URL Requests. If this value is specified and the path of the HTTP Requests does not match this Regular Expression, the Processor will respond with a 404: NotFound
value.name: Allowed Paths

value.description: The character set to use for decoding URL parameters if the HTTP Request does not supply one
value.name: Default URL Character Set

value.description: Allow HTTP GET Method
value.name: Allow GET

value.description: Allow HTTP POST Method
value.name: Allow POST

value.description: Allow HTTP PUT Method
value.name: Allow PUT

value.description: Allow HTTP DELETE Method
value.name: Allow DELETE

value.description: Allow HTTP HEAD Method
value.name: Allow HEAD

value.description: Allow HTTP OPTIONS Method
value.name: Allow OPTIONS

value.description: A comma-separated list of non-standard HTTP Methods that should be allowed
value.name: Additional HTTP Methods

allowableValues.description: Processor will not authenticate clients. Anyone can communicate with this Processor anonymously
Processor will try to verify the client but if unable to verify will allow the client to communicate anonymously
Processor will reject communications from any client unless the client provides a certificate that is trusted by the TrustStorespecified in the SSL Context Service

value.description: Specifies whether or not the Processor should authenticate clients. This value is ignored if the <SSL Context Service> Property is not specified or the SSL Context provided uses only a KeyStore and not a TrustStore.
value.name: Client Authentication

value.description: The HTTP Status Code to use when responding to the HTTP Request. See Section 10 of RFC 2616 for more information.
value.name: HTTP Status Code

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: The URL to POST to. The first part of the URL must be static. However, the path of the URL may be defined using the Attribute Expression Language. For example, https://${hostname} is not valid, but https://1.1.1.1:8080/files/${nf.file.name} is valid.
value.name: URL

value.description: If the Send as FlowFile property is true, specifies the max data size for a batch of FlowFiles to send in a single HTTP POST. If not specified, each FlowFile will be sent separately. If the Send as FlowFile property is false, this property is ignored
value.name: Max Batch Size

entry.key: Max Data to Post per Second

value.description: The maximum amount of data to send per second; this allows the bandwidth to be throttled to a specified data rate; if not specified, the data rate is not throttled
value.displayName: Max Data to Post per Second
value.name: Max Data to Post per Second

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Username required to access the URL
value.name: Username

value.description: Password required to access the URL
value.name: Password

value.description: If true, will package the FlowFile's contents and attributes together and send the FlowFile Package; otherwise, will send only the FlowFile's content
value.name: Send as FlowFile

value.description: Specifies whether or not to use Chunked Encoding to send the data. If false, the entire content of the FlowFile will be buffered into memory.
value.name: Use Chunked Encoding

value.description: Determines the GZIP Compression Level to use when sending the file; the value must be in the range of 0-9. A value of 0 indicates that the file will not be GZIP'ed
value.name: Compression Level

value.description: How long to wait when attempting to connect to the remote server before giving up
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: How long to wait between receiving segments of data from the remote server before giving up and discarding the partial file
value.name: Data Timeout

entry.key: Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)

value.description: Specifies the Regular Expression that determines the names of FlowFile attributes that should be sent as HTTP Headers
value.displayName: Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)
value.name: Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)

value.description: What to report as the User Agent when we connect to the remote server
value.name: User Agent

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

entry.key: Max Data to Post per Second
Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)

relationships.description: Files that fail to send will transferred to failure
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that are successfully send will be transferred to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: The HTTP Status Code to use when responding to the HTTP Request. See Section 10 of RFC 2616 for more information.
value.name: HTTP Status Code

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be routed to this Relationship if the Processor is unable to respond to the requestor. This may happen, for instance, if the connection times out or if NiFi is restarted before responding to the HTTP Request.
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be routed to this Relationship after the response has been successfully sent to the requestor
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Log Level to use when logging the Attributes
value.name: Log Level

value.description: If true, the FlowFile's payload will be logged, in addition to its attributes; otherwise, just the Attributes will be logged.
value.name: Log Payload

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to Log. If not specified, all attributes will be logged.
value.name: Attributes to Log

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to ignore. If not specified, no attributes will be ignored.
value.name: Attributes to Ignore

value.description: Log prefix appended to the log lines. It helps to distinguish the output of multiple LogAttribute processors.
value.name: Log prefix

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The size of the file that will be used
value.name: File Size

value.description: The number of FlowFiles to be transferred in each invocation
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: Specifies whether the data should be Text or Binary
value.name: Data Format

value.description: If true, each FlowFile that is generated will be unique. If false, a random value will be generated and all FlowFiles will get the same content but this offers much higher throughput
value.name: Unique FlowFiles

value.description: The Log Level to use when logging the Attributes
value.name: Log Level

value.description: If true, the FlowFile's payload will be logged, in addition to its attributes; otherwise, just the Attributes will be logged.
value.name: Log Payload

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to Log. If not specified, all attributes will be logged.
value.name: Attributes to Log

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to ignore. If not specified, no attributes will be ignored.
value.name: Attributes to Ignore

value.description: Log prefix appended to the log lines. It helps to distinguish the output of multiple LogAttribute processors.
value.name: Log prefix

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Log Level to use when logging the Attributes
value.name: Log Level

value.description: If true, the FlowFile's payload will be logged, in addition to its attributes; otherwise, just the Attributes will be logged.
value.name: Log Payload

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to Log. If not specified, all attributes will be logged.
value.name: Attributes to Log

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to ignore. If not specified, no attributes will be ignored.
value.name: Attributes to Ignore

value.description: Log prefix appended to the log lines. It helps to distinguish the output of multiple LogAttribute processors.
value.name: Log prefix

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Log Level to use when logging the Attributes
value.name: Log Level

value.description: If true, the FlowFile's payload will be logged, in addition to its attributes; otherwise, just the Attributes will be logged.
value.name: Log Payload

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to Log. If not specified, all attributes will be logged.
value.name: Attributes to Log

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to ignore. If not specified, no attributes will be ignored.
value.name: Attributes to Ignore

value.description: Log prefix appended to the log lines. It helps to distinguish the output of multiple LogAttribute processors.
value.name: Log prefix

relationships.name: success

value.description: The Log Level to use when logging the Attributes
value.name: Log Level

value.description: If true, the FlowFile's payload will be logged, in addition to its attributes; otherwise, just the Attributes will be logged.
value.name: Log Payload

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to Log. If not specified, all attributes will be logged.
value.name: Attributes to Log

value.description: A comma-separated list of Attributes to ignore. If not specified, no attributes will be ignored.
value.name: Attributes to Ignore

value.description: Log prefix appended to the log lines. It helps to distinguish the output of multiple LogAttribute processors.
value.name: Log prefix

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming HTTP requests
value.name: Listening Port

value.description: The Hostname to bind to. If not specified, will bind to all hosts
value.name: Hostname

value.description: The SSL Context Service to use in order to secure the server. If specified, the server will accept only HTTPS requests; otherwise, the server will accept only HTTP requests
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: A Regular Expression that specifies the valid HTTP Paths that are allowed in the incoming URL Requests. If this value is specified and the path of the HTTP Requests does not match this Regular Expression, the Processor will respond with a 404: NotFound
value.name: Allowed Paths

value.name: Default URL Character Set

value.name: Allow DELETE

value.description: Allow HTTP HEAD Method
value.name: Allow HEAD

value.description: Allow HTTP OPTIONS Method
value.name: Allow OPTIONS

value.name: Additional HTTP Methods

allowableValues.description: Processor will not authenticate clients. Anyone can communicate with this Processor anonymously
Processor will try to verify the client but if unable to verify will allow the client to communicate anonymously
Processor will reject communications from any client unless the client provides a certificate that is trusted by the TrustStorespecified in the SSL Context Service

value.description: Specifies whether or not the Processor should authenticate clients. This value is ignored if the <SSL Context Service> Property is not specified or the SSL Context provided uses only a KeyStore and not a TrustStore.
value.name: Client Authentication

relationships.description: All content that is received is routed to the 'success' relationship
relationships.name: success
